item.title: Perl - Operators
item.description: Perl operators are symbols that represent a specific operation to be performed on one or more operands. Operators are used in expressions, which are statements that use values and operators to produce a value. Operators are a hugely important part of programming. They tell your computer what you want it to do with a given input. Numeric operators Perl has a variety of numeric operators to help you manipulate numbers, including arithmetic, Boolean, and bitwise operations.
